docs.lead_paragraph: What is good for the country in the short run is at odds with what is good in the long run.

headline.main: Our Economic Growth Is a Mystery. Obamacare Is the Reason.
headline.print_headline: Why Is Our Economic Growth a Mystery? Obamacare

docs.abstract: The Upshot; news analysis; uncertainties in how health care reform will impact United States economy make it difficult to use traditional measures as gauge; while short-term decline in GDP, due primarily to reduction in health care spending, looks troubling for the economy, it could portend a rosier economic picture down the road.
docs.snippet: What is good for the country in the short run is at odds with what is good in the long run.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Some financial firms are providing online tools to help customers see what their peers are saving for retirement, in the hope of stepping up their game.

headline.seo: For Retirement, Online Tools Can Encourage Greater Saving
headline.main: A Nudge to Save a Bit More
headline.print_headline: A Nudge to Save a Bit More

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column suggests that social media and online financial tools should do more to support individual saving rather than highlight spending behaviors; shares success story of Putnam Investments and their tool that allows participants to compare their savings and retirement funds against other account holders.
docs.snippet: Some financial firms are providing online tools to help customers see what their peers are saving for retirement, in the hope of stepping up their game.

docs.lead_paragraph: Days before most U.S. states' new fiscal year begins, 40 states have passed budgets that boost spending and dedicate extra funding primarily for education, according to a brief released on Friday by the National Association of State Budget Officers.

headline.print_headline: U.S. States Greet New Fiscal Year With More Spending, School Funding

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced that most people would be able to renew subsidized health insurance coverage without filing an application.

headline.main: Most Will Be Able to Automatically Renew Coverage Under Health Law
headline.print_headline: Most Will Be Able to Automatically Renew Coverage Under Health Law

docs.abstract: Obama administration announces that most people will be able to renew subsidized health insurance coverage without filing an application and without going back to website HealthCare.gov.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration announced that most people would be able to renew subsidized health insurance coverage without filing an application.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: But Obamacare wasn’t supposed to work! What were all those cries of impending disaster about?

headline.seo: So Much for Obamacare Not Working

docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column argues that continued success of the Affordable Care Act belies chorus of conservative critics who warned that law would become a national disaster; contends that such persistent error can only occur when one is guided by political dogma rather than analysis; warns that many are still clinging to senseless opposition to law despite facts, and holds such critics represent continued political danger.
docs.snippet: But Obamacare wasn’t supposed to work! What were all those cries of impending disaster about?
